column5: Sample Question
column6: Example Prospect Answer

column5: “Do you have the financial ability to move forward if it’s a fit?”
column6: “No, I’m between jobs and have nothing saved.”

column5: “Could this be something you budget for or use credit if needed?”
column6: “Maybe. I’d have to think about how to shift things.”

column5: “Is the investment within your reach?”
column6: “Yes, I have funds or access if I feel it’s right.”

column5: “Is this within your current budget?”
column6: “No. We’re frozen until next fiscal cycle.”

column5: “Could funds be moved or unlocked?”
column6: “Possibly. Depends on internal discussions.”

column5: “Is there budget earmarked for this problem?”
column6: “Yes, or I can pull from discretionary funds.”

column5: “Do you have the funds for staging, repairs, or closing costs?”
column6: “No, I’d have to wait or borrow.”

column5: “Can you cover partial costs or stretch a little if needed?”
column6: “Maybe, but it’d be tight.”

column5: “Are you financially ready to prep and list?”
column6: “Yes, I have the means or credit ready.”

column5: “Have you ever invested in coaching or growth before?”
column6: “No, I usually just read free stuff.”

column5: “How do you see investing in yourself?”
column6: “It sounds good, but I’m still getting used to the idea.”

column5: “Do you see this as something worth investing in?”
column6: “Absolutely. I’ve invested before and it changed my life.”

column5: “Is this seen as a necessary expense internally?”
column6: “Not really. Leadership doesn’t prioritize it.”

column5: “How do you value outside solutions?”
column6: “We’ve tried some, but leadership still hesitates.”

column5: “Is this a type of tool/service your org believes in?”
column6: “Yes. We invest in areas with strong ROI.”

column5: “Do you see value in paying for professional help or prep?”
column6: “No, I don’t want to spend money upfront.”

column5: “Have you considered what impact investment might make?”
column6: “I’m curious, but I’d need convincing.”

column5: “Are you open to investing in services to improve your outcome?”
column6: “Yes — I see it as necessary to get top dollar.”

column5: “If you knew this would change your life, what would you do?”
column6: “Nothing — if I don’t have the money, it’s a no.”

column5: “Would you explore options if this felt right?”
column6: “I’d consider it, but I’d be nervous.”

column5: “Would you find a way if it really aligned?”
column6: “Yes — I’ve moved mountains for things that matter.”

column5: “Is it possible to reallocate or borrow from another budget?”
column6: “No — we’re locked down.”

column5: “Are there alternate funding paths you could explore?”
column6: “Maybe, I’d have to ask.”

column5: “Would you make a business case to unlock the budget?”
column6: “Yes — if it solves a big pain, we get scrappy.”

column5: “If staging could help your sale, would you find a way to pay?”
column6: “No, I just can’t.”

column5: “Would you explore partial options or creative strategies?”
column6: “I guess so, depending on results.”

column5: “Would you pull from savings, credit, or future equity if needed?”
column6: “Yes — if it helps the sale, I’ll figure it out.”

column5: “How do you usually feel about making financial decisions?”
column6: “Anxious. I avoid them or delay forever.”

column5: “Do you feel confident choosing when to invest?”
column6: “Sometimes — depends on the pressure.”

column5: “How do you feel about this kind of money decision?”
column6: “I’m clear and intentional. I trust myself to choose well.”

column5: “What’s the energy around budget decisions in your org?”
column6: “Tense. People are afraid to take initiative.”

column5: “Are your team’s spending decisions confident or hesitant?”
column6: “Mixed. Some play it safe, others push for value.”

column5: “How comfortable is your team making smart investments?”
column6: “We’re decisive — when there’s ROI, we act fast.”

column5: “How do you feel about spending money during the sale?”
column6: “Nervous — I’d rather not spend at all.”

column5: “Do you usually feel clear making financial choices?”
column6: “Not always — depends on timing.”

column5: “Are you comfortable investing to get the best outcome?”
column6: “Yes. I’ve done it before and it paid off.”
